title: Part (a)

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The response does not earn credit for describing loss of habitat or decreasing biodiversity.
descriptions: The response does not describe one possible negative environmental impact of clear-cutting large areas of old-growth forests, such as:
The response describes one possible negative environmental impact of clear-cutting large areas of old-growth forests, such as:

title: Part (c)(i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain how the proposed approach could increase the amount of biodiversity more than the old-growth forest alone. For example:
The response explains how the proposed approach could increase the amount of biodiversity more than the old growth forest alone. For example:

title: Part (c)(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not propose the technique of selective cutting/selective felling/single-tree selection.
The response proposes the technique of selective cutting/selective felling/single-tree selection.

title: (c)(iii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain how the proposal in (c)(ii) would meet both goals.
The response explains how the proposal in (c)(ii) would meet both goals.

title: (d)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The response can indicate only one country.
descriptions: The response does not indicate Australia.
The response indicates Australia.

title: (d)(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe one advantage of reusing or recycling iron such as the following:

title: Part (d)(iii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain why the United States would be the country most likely to benefit from reusing or recycling iron rather than mining iron. For example:

title: Part (e)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The response must describe, not just identify, a negative impact.
descriptions: The response does not describe one of the following negative impacts of tailing piles left at iron mine sites.
The response does not describe one of the following negative impacts of tailings piles left at iron mine sites.

title: Part (e)(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not propose a reasonable solution such as the following for reducing or eliminating the effects of an iron mine site on the environment:
